wikipedia_page.main: Dr Brysson Cunningham FRSE DSc MICE (1868-1950) was a Scottish civil engineer and author specialising in harbour and dock design and operation. In the early 20th century he was generally viewed as the authority in this field.

response: *Brysson Cunningham, Scottish harbour engineer and author on dock and harbour engineering and operation

In 1930 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were Arthur Crichton Mitchell, Brysson Cunningham, Sir James Alfred Ewing and David Alan Stevenson. He resigned in 1940.
In 1923 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were John Edward Aloysius Steggall, Brysson Cunningham, George Forbes, William R. Hodgkinson and Sir James Dewar.
